intro: Anemotrochus viridivenius, commonly known as the green-veined anemotrochus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves with prominent green veins and clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth near water sources. Its flowers emit a mild fragrance that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
